PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Balanзo hнdrico e de energia em solo cultivado com mamona (Ricinus communis L) nas condiзхes do Brejo Paraibano: experimentaзгo e modelagem
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: A cultura da mamona pode ser uma alternativa viбvel para a substituiзгo da cana-de-aзъcar na regiгo do Brejo Paraibano, tendo em vista o uso do уleo de mamona para produзгo de biodiesel, um sucedвneo do diesel, ser uma das alternativas brasileiras para reduзгo da importaзгo de petrуleo e da emissгo de poluentes e gases de "Efeito Estufa" na atmosfera. O projeto tem como objetivo o estudo e a modelagem dos processos de transferкncia de бgua e de energia em solo cultivado com a cultura da mamona. Ele consiste de duas partes interrelacionadas: 1) experimental e 2) modelagem computacional. A parte experimental serб realizada numa бrea de 4 ha do Centro de Ciкncias Agrбrias, UFPB, localizada no municнpio de Areia, PB (6o 58' S, 35o 41' W). Para a determinaзгo do balanзo de energia, a бrea serб instrumentada com um pluviуgrafo, um piranфmetro, um radiфmetro e sensores para medidas da temperatura e da umidade relativa do ar e da velocidade do vento, em dois nнveis acima da superfнcie do solo. Dois locais, no solo serгo instrumentados, cada um com duas sondas tйrmicas instaladas horizontalmente nas profundidades de z1 = 2,0 cm e z2 = 8,0 cm, e um fluxнmetro, para a medida do fluxo de calor no solo, a z1 = 5,0 cm. Essas medidas serгo armazenadas a cada 30 minutos num datalogger. Para a determinaзгo do balanзo hнdrico, serгo instalados trкs sнtios tensio-neutrфnicos, contendo um tubo de acesso para sonda de nкutrons e oito tensiфmetros. Para a modelagem computacional serб implementado o cуdigo computacional "SiSPAT (Simple Soil?Plant?Atmosphere Transfer Model)." O modelo SiSPAT й dividido em quatro mуdulos, que descrevem as transferкncias de бgua e de energia no solo, na atmosfera, na interface solo?planta?atmosfera e na interface solo?planta. O estudo contribuirб para uma melhor compreensгo dos processos de transferкncia de бgua e de energia em solo cultivado com a cultura da mamona, visando uma gestгo integrada dos recursos naturais da regiгo do Brejo Paraibano.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Transferкncia de Бgua e de Misturas de Poluentes Reativos em Solos antropizados
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Edital universal MCTI/CNPq 2018. Os processos de urbanizaзгo que ocorrem sobre as bacias hidrogrбficas geram uma forte pressгo espacial sobre sua бrea de abrangкncia, tornando-a cada vez mais vulnerбvel аs modificaзхes de uso e ocupaзгo do solo. Essa crescente urbanizaзгo gerou um quadro caуtico em muitas cidades, por nгo possuнrem uma infraestrutura adequada para suportar essa elevada taxa populacional. Isso ocorre pela falta de um planejamento integrado entre as infraestruturas que compхem a cidade, profissionais especializados e legislaзхes vigentes, principalmente nos вmbitos urbano e ambiental. A gestгo dos recursos hнdricos constitui atualmente uma das maiores preocupaзхes socioeconфmicas em escala mundial. O crescimento da pressгo exercida sobre as бguas de superfнcie e subterrвneas, relacionadas notadamente aos aportes de substвncias poluentes, tem conduzido a comunidade cientнfica a se interrogar sobre a elaboraзгo de ferramentas que permitam melhor compreender a gestгo integrada do ciclo da бgua, tanto em termos de eficiкncia ambiental como em termos de custos, e isto a diferentes escalas de tempo e de espaзo. Neste contexto, o conhecimento do transporte de бgua e solutos em solos, considerado em seu contexto natural - a interaзгo com os aquнferos de uma parte, e coma atmosfera de outra parte - desempenha um papel essencial. Uma pesquisa multidisciplinar serб conduzida seguindo um procedimento sistemбtico a fim de aprofundar o conhecimento dos mecanismos de transporte e das interaзхes de substвncias quнmicas (contaminantes emergentes, hidrocarbonetos e metais pesados) como solo,.Conhecimento dos mecanismos de transporte e das interaзхes de substвncias quнmicas (contaminantes emergentes, hidrocarbonetos e metais pesados) como solo, no intuito de melhorar a modelagem das transferкncias e das transformaзхes de substвncias quнmicas no meio ambiente. O destino de substвncias quнmicas no meio ambiente, suas interaзхes e transformaзхes nos solos, ainda й um desafio para a comunidade cientifica. Esforзos crescentes em pesquisa vкm sendo dispensados na compreensгo do comportamento de poluentes em misturas, sejam metais, hidrocarbonetos e contaminantes emergentes. Й imperioso que o estudo dinвmico de misturas de diferentes grupos de contaminantes seja realizado, pois favorece a compreensгo da dinвmica desses poluentes no ambiente e os efeitos sinergйticos que sгo capazes de exercer uns sobre os outros.Й igualmente importante compreender a mobilizaзгo de poluentes sob forma solъvel e coloidal durante a infiltraзгo de бgua/drenagem, sob a variaзгo das condiзхes redox, etc. O impacto desses fenфmenos sobre a percolaзгo profunda de substвncias quнmicas poluentes й atualmente reconhecido. A compreensгo e a quantificaзгo desses fenфmenos sгo de fundamental importвncia para a preservaзгo da qualidade dos recursos hнdricos. Motivado por uma preocupaзгo ambiental, o projeto tem igualmente de pesquisa fundamental. Ele se insere no aprofundamento do conhecimento sobre a dinвmica e os mecanismos das interaзхes de poluentes modelos (metais pesados, hidrocarbonetos e contaminantes emergentes), isolados ou em mistura, em solos urbanos em relaзгo com suas propriedades texturais e estruturais, e suas consequкncias sobre o transporte e as transformaзхes de poluentes. A integraзгo destes conhecimentos na modelagem de substвncias quнmicas (metais pesados, hidrocarbonetos e contaminantes emergentes) no sistema solo-aquнfero em clima tropical. O principal objetivo deste projeto й, portanto, a colocaзгo em comum das energias e dos conhecimentos em domнnios bastante diversificados, mas complementares, conforme dois eixos principais de pesquisa: Eixo 1 : Estudo das Interaзхes e dos processos de transporte de poluentes modelos (metais pesados, hidrocarbonetos e contaminantes emergentes), isolados ou em mistura, em solos urbanos.

As atividades, como oficinas, mesas de debates, visitas tйcnicas, passeios de pedal e catamarг, plantio de mudas e aзхes de limpeza, criaram um ambiente de aprendizado e engajamento, fortalecendo a conscientizaзгo ambiental e o senso de responsabilidade coletiva.Alйm disso, a Conferкncia reforзou a importвncia do envolvimento comunitбrio para a preservaзгo dos recursos hнdricos, conforme apontado por pesquisas da UFPE, que destacam a necessidade de integrar intervenзхes estruturais de revitalizaзгo a aзхes de conscientizaзгo e engajamento local.A realizaзгo deste evento foi possнvel graзas ao incentivo da FACEPE, que foi reconhecida com o tнtulo de "Entidade Amiga do Capibaribe", destacando o impacto significativo da Conferкncia na promoзгo de prбticas sustentбveis e no fortalecimento da relaзгo entre a sociedade e a gestгo dos recursos hнdricos.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Knowledge of heavy rainfall is extremely important due to its application in hydraulic engineering projects. The difficulty in obtaining rainfall equations through pluviographs due to the low-intensity pluviographs network has led engineers to use other methods for determining these equations through pluviometric records. In this work were used historical data from 06 municipalities of meso-regions of Pernambuco State to determine rainfall equations using Bell?s method (1969) and rainfall disaggregation method. The adherence of data to Gumbel distribution was confirmed by the Kolmogorov-Smirnov test with a significance level of 5%. The generated equations showed reasonable fits with RІ ranging from 96.8% to 97.9% for rainfall disaggregation method and above 99.2% for the Bell?s method.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: - Methodologies for determining the rainfall equations through precipitation records have been increasingly used due to low density network pluviographs and lack of long historical series. This study evaluates the performance of Bell(1969) and relationships between durations methods, methods that use rainfall records, with the IDF equation generated through pluviographic data for the city of Recife. The coefficients of determination (RІ) of Bell and relationships between durations were respectively 0.9872 and 0.9708 showing that both methods have a good fit to the existing IDF equation for the city of Recife.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Urban drainage before conceptualized the rapid runoff of rainwater, has appeared unsustainable in the urban environment. The Metropolitan Region of Recife (MRR) suffers from the consequences of precipitation, even when it occurs at low intensities. This situation, the Federal University of Pernambuco ? UFPE been studying techniques to compensate the effects of urbanization on existing drainage, as overload in the system and the increase in peak flows. Were implanted four compensatory techniques: reservoir detention, permeable pavement, rain garden and a green roof, in addition to studying the issue of urban streams in the region. Despite the initiative from these four experiments, we note that the implementation of these techniques is still a challenge in MRR, maiznly because it requires breaking paradigms and interests of professionals, public and private actors, and especially the population.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
The management of emerging pollutants is an enormous challenge to prevent soil
and water contamination. This study aims to conduct a literature review regarding the effects of
antibiotics in the soil, the sorption mechanisms and the application of Batch and column to
determine the hydro dispersive parameters. As well as, the factors that influence their persistence
and degradation, presenting a focus on the compound sulfadiazine (SDZ). The review shows that
the understanding of the sorption mechanism in batch and column can assist in the development of measures, techniques or actions. These will seek to minimize the effects of sulfadiazine or similar
antibiotic in the soil, either in agricultural or urban environment.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Telhado verde: desempenho do sistema construtivo na reduзгo do escoamento superficial

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Nowadays, half of the world?s population lives in urban areas, and the negative impacts of hydrological events have been recurrent due to growing urbanization, impervious soil coverage, and the consequent reduction in infiltration rates leading to decreasing aquifer recharge and surface runoff. Thus, runoff increases, intensifying peak flows and flood events. By contrast, green roofs have been applied for some time in several parts of the world both for architectural-aesthetic reasons and to improve environmental comfort. Moreover, they are also being used in view of their performance as an urban runoff control device. Considering actual characteristics and field data, an experiment was performed in order to investigate the water dynamics in two green roof systems. The Hydrus-1D unsaturated flow numerical model was used to process the data, considering different rainfall rates. The analyses of the hydrograms produced consistent qualitative and quantitative results, and it was possible to conclude that, for the climate conditions of the area investigated, green roofs are important devices to be used in the reduction of runoff from traditional roofs.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: A sustainable approach to urban stormwater drainage must integrate the entireurban drainage system. One way to achieve this is to maximize infiltration rates on the land lot by using rain gardens, which are a compensatory technique based on bioretention and waterproof areas compensation. This paper presents an experimental rain garden study, implemented in Recife, Brazil, evaluating the retention, storage and infiltration of the rainwater collected from the roof. Due to the high infiltration rates on the surface (312,0 mm/h), the waters quickly infiltrate into the structure. The models introduced by Horton and Mezencev were used to simulate the infiltration characteristics of the natural soil and those of the first layer of the rain garden, yielding satisfactory results. A financial cost analysis was carried out in order to estimate installation costs for recurrence times of 2, 5, 10 and 25 years, and rain durations of 10 min to 120 min. During the monitoring period, no overflow was observed. The pilot rain garden presented good results and proved to be a suitable technique for stormwater management.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Hydrodynamic behavior of soils in recession agriculture was evaluated through of
the soil water characteristic curve θ(h), hydraulic conductivity as a function of the
soil water potential K(h), sorptivity S, and characteristic pore radius λm, in two
Fluvents soils at the recession emerging zone of Cajueiro and Flocos reservoirs, in
Tuparetama, PE. The soil of Cajueiro shows a little transition of texture and dry bulk
density, while the soil from Flocos has an evident transition from texture and bulk
density with depth. The curves θ(h) were obtained by fitting the model proposed by
van Genuchten to field data (obtained with tensiometers and a neutron scattering
probe), and to laboratory data (obtained with a Richards pressure chamber).
Experiments on the disk infiltrometer (0.08 m diameter base) were performed for
obtaining K and S values, at the depths of 0, 0.20, 0.40, 0.60 and 0.80 m, applying
four water potentials. The θ(h) curves showed good agreement for potentials ranging
from -30 to -10 kPa, indicating the good quality of the experimental data. The soil
hydrodynamic heterogeneity in Flocos may be explained by texture and dry bulk
density and in Cajueiro this heterogeneity is induced by the pore size distribution.
The diameter of the infiltrometer that was used together with the applied pressures,
have allowed characterizing the porous matrix of the clay layer of Flocos.
Keywords: Hydraulic conductivity, sorptivity, disc infiltrometer, texture.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Microtomografia computadorizada de raios-X na caracterizaзгo morfomйtrica dos poros de Neossolo Regolнtico Eutrofico
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Microtomografia computadorizada de raios-X na caracterizaзгo morfomйtrica dos poros de Neossolo Regolнtico Eutrofico

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Soil particles arrangement, orientation and organization determine soil structure and
soil porosity. The porosity has a strong influence on aeration, flux of
water/solute/gas/heat, roots resistance to penetration, microorganism development
and is important to determining the soil quality. The morphometric analysis of the
pore space of a Regossols using the X-rays computed microtomography is the
objective of this study, where the soil physical attributes and the sizes, shapes and
slopes of the intra-aggregate voids were analyze. The Regossol had a porosity of 28%
(27% inter-aggregate void and 1% intra-aggregate void) and 73% of aggregates.
About 73% of intra-aggregate voids have volumes of 1,278 x 6,545 x 10-4 to 10-2
mmі. There is a greater volume of complex and elongated voids, which favor the
driving water through the soil. In addition, a larger volume of flattened pores that
may indicate a certain compression that medium. Intra-aggregate voids showed
mostly as nearly horizontal or inclined, as a result of resistance to root penetration
due to presence of clay bridges ('lamellic') in the soil. The application of X-rays
computed microtomography is efficient for micromorphometric characterization of
soil porosity.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Modeling of the Hydrological Processes in Caatinga and Pasture Areas in the Brazilian Semi-Arid

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: CARVALHO DE GUSMГO DA CUNHA RABELO, ANA EMНLIA
AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: CARVALHO DE GUSMГO DA CUNHA RABELO, ANA EMНLIA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The semi-arid regions of northeastern Brazil have historically suffered from water shortage. In this context, monitoring and modeling the soil moisture?s dynamics with hydrological models in natural (Caatinga) and degraded (Pasture) regions is of fundamental importance to understand the dynamics of hydrological processes. Therefore, this work aims to evaluate the hydraulic parameters in Caatinga and Pasture areas using the Hydrus-1D inverse method. Thus, five soil hydraulic models present in Hydrus-1D were used, allowing the comparison of the single-porosity model with more complex models, which consider the dual porosity and the hysteresis of the porous medium. The hydraulic models showed better adjustments in the Caatinga area (RMSE = 0.01?0.02, R2 = 0.61?0.97) than in the Pasture area (RMSE = 0.01?0.03, R2 = 0.61?0.90). Regarding the hydraulic parameters, for all models, the Pasture showed smaller saturated hydraulic conductivity and water content values of the mobile region than the Caatinga. This fact demonstrates the negative impact of compaction and change in natural vegetation in the Brazilian semi-arid. The dual-porosity model presented the best fit to the data measured in the Pasture area. However, a single-porosity model could be considered representative of the Caatinga area. The results showed that Caatinga areas contribute to maintaining soil moisture and increasing the water storage in semi-arid regions.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Sorption studies of Cd and Cu on Brazilian alluvial soils
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Sorption studies of Cd and Cu on Brazilian alluvial soils

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Captaзгo, tratamento e distribuiзгo de бgua

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
The Local Production Arrangement, located in the Pernambuco?s Agreste state, has been
significantly developing the region's economy. Despite its importance, industrial activity has
caused relevant environmental concerns regarding the disposal of textile effluents, especially
from industrial laundries. This waste is made up of many chemicals, and among them are
various types of heavy metals. The evaluation of the sorption behavior of contaminant transport
mechanisms such as heavy metals is essential to assess the risk of contamination of alluvial
aquifers. This study evaluated the sorption of heavy metals (Cu and Cd) in an alluvial sediment
deposit in the Capibaribe River. Kinetics and isotherm experiments allowed the analyses of Cu
and Cd sorption. Kinetics sorption showed an equilibrium tendency after 16 h for Cu and 18 h
for Cd and was better described by a pseudo-second order model. The isotherm data were
adjusted to the Linear, Freundlich and Langmuir models. Both linear and Freundlich models
satisfactorily described sorption isotherms for the two pollutants. The metals in the study
represent a risk of contamination of the groundwater of alluvial aquifers, mainly due to
physicochemical attributes of the soil, such as high sand content (85%), low MO (2.1 g kg-1)
and alkaline pH (8.2). The environmental conditions decrease absorption and facilitate metal
mobility, greatly increasing the environmental risks inherent in pollutant leaching. Cu showed
a higher affinity with the soil studied in all assays performed compared with the results of the
tests for Cd.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Transport Behavior of RB5 Dye in Alluvial Soil in the Northeast of Brazil
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Transport Behavior of RB5 Dye in Alluvial Soil in the Northeast of Brazil

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The textile industry generates a large volume of chemically diversified effluents containing, among other compounds, dyes. Untreated wastes are contaminants to surface water, soil, and groundwater. In this aspect, various studies have explored the issue of contamination of alluvial soils in the Alto Capibaribe region, northeast of Brazil, due to local textile activity. This region, inserted into the Brazilian semiarid region, suffers from water scarcity, and there is a need for rural communities to use alluvial formations for water supply. The simulation of solute transport is a fundamental tool for understanding the environmental performance and risks associated with contamination by textile dyes. Transport parameters that directly influence pollutant dynamics in sedimentary environments are characterized. This study evaluated the retention and mobility of the dye Remazol Black 5 (RB5) in two superficial layers of alluvial soil from Alto Capibaribe to obtain transport parameters. In the laboratory, tests of mobility in soil columns with RB5 dye (concentration of the 25 mg L−1) and KBr tracer (concentration of the 35.7 g L−1) solutions were conducted. The CDE and two-region models were used to model the KBr experimental transport data, and the two-site model was used to model the RB5 experimental transport data. Physical non-equilibrium was found in the soils for KBr transport, and the two-region model adequately modeled the experimental breakthrough curves (BTCs). For the transport of RB5, the results showed a chemical non-equilibrium, and the two-site model was adequate to model the experimental BTCs. The results indicate that the surface layer is most responsible for the retention of RB5, where the RB5 solution was less mobile than in the lower layer. Both layers showed low retention and high mobility for RB5, indicating that the RB5 dye in the region may contaminate groundwater

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A necessidade de implantaзгo efetiva de legislaзгo, no que se refere а gestгo de бguas subterrвneas, tem sido alvo de atenзгo e motivo de desafio por parte dos governantes e pela sociedade civil, especialmente pelo intuito de incentivar o uso mais racional e sustentбvel deste recurso. No Brasil, principalmente nas regiхes metropolitanas, observa-se um crescimento vertiginoso do uso destas бguas, por possibilitar, dentre outros, maior regularidade de vazхes e menor custo aos usuбrios. Destaca-se, entretanto, a evoluзгo quanto aos aspectos jurнdico-institucionais das unidades federativas, apesar de ainda persistirem entraves no tocante ao cumprimento dos planos e aзхes sugeridos pelas polнticas estaduais. Este trabalho visa analisar e comparar os sistemas de gestгo dos recursos hнdricos subterrвneos nos estados de Pernambuco, Cearб e Sгo Paulo e recomenda a criaзгo de comissхes gestoras de бguas subterrвneas que desenvolvam diagnуsticos e propostas que subsidiem o gerenciamento de aqьнferos, assim como ocorre com os comitкs de bacias hidrogrбficas que dedicam atenзгo especial аs бguas superficiais.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The need for an effective implementation of legislation regarding the management of groundwater has been a challenge to government and civil society, especially in order to encourage the sustainable use. In Brazil, mainly in metropolitan areas, there is intensive increase of the use of these waters by allowing, among other, more regular flows and lower cost to users. However, it is very important, developments on the legal and institutional aspects of federal units, although difficulties still persist regarding the fulfillment of plans and actions suggested by state policies. This paper aims to analyze and compare the groundwater management systems in the states of Pernambuco, Ceara and Sao Paulo and suggests the creation of management organization of groundwater that carries out diagnosis and proposals to the aquifers management, as with the river basin committees that give special attention to surface water.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Knowledge of heavy rainfall is extremely important due to its application in hydraulic engineering projects. The difficulty in obtaining rainfall equations through pluviographs due to the low-intensity pluviographs network has led engineers to use other methods for determining these equations through pluviometric records. In this work were used historical data from 06 municipalities of meso-regions of Pernambuco State to determine rainfall equations using Bell?s method (1969) and rainfall disaggregation method. The adherence of data to Gumbel distribution was confirmed by the Kolmogorov-Smirnov test with a significance level of 5%. The generated equations showed reasonable fits with RІ ranging from 96.8% to 97.9% for rainfall disaggregation method and above 99.2% for the Bell?s method.
